intro: Hymenoxys scaposa var. linearis, commonly known as the linear hymenoxys, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its growth habit is usually low and spreading, with stems that often lie close to the ground. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its showy, composite flower heads.
